content.description: Start on the obvious, lowest jugs of the Mom boulder directly in the center of the cave. Climb about ten feet to an obvious undercling, then climb right into Karncruncher and topout. Pretty much this climb is just a low start into Karncrucher
content.location: In the middle of the Mom boulder between Mom's problem and Karncruncher

content.description:
Another very good problem in the Party Pit in the V6/7 range. A bit sharp.

Start on the arete with a low right hand crimp, and a side pull left of the arete. Climb the arete using side pulls and a blocky pinch. Grab a good edge over the lip, match, and push out a kinda hard mantel
content.protection: 4 four pads are ideal. A number of boulders in the landing zone. A spotter for the topout.
content.location: This is actually on the boulder that leans against the west face of the Mom Boulder, at Karnkruncher. It goes up the arete that faces north (towards the road).

content.description: Continuous 5.10 climbing on great holds. Confidence is needed.
content.protection: Quite safe with a few pads

content.description:
Another gem on the backside of the mom boulder. This one is similar to Face Off (left), but the holds are smaller, it is longer, and the landing is worse.

Flaky rock, still, unfortunately, which detracts a star for me. But the movement is phenomenal.

The hard part is low, so to extract the most value (and difficulty) out of this one, you need to start as low as possible. Start sitting with a thin pad on the rock. Feet go about as low down on the wall as I can get them, left hand is near my waist, on an oblong rounded hold. Right hand is a little higher, on a crimpy little ball-- maybe shoulder height when I am sitting (this hold is circled in Tanner's LCC app guidebook). Power up through techy slopey holds, and after about 3 moves (at my height), you get to the halfway mark, mentioned below.

Well worth a try if you've already done the others in roughly this difficulty range in the area.

If you start on the good holds halfway up the boulder, it goes at roughly the same difficulty as Face Off (left).

Sometimes given v10, and could be.
content.protection: nice to have 5-6 pads if possible
content.location: Backside of Mom boulder, on the big gentle overhang.

content.description:
Rad little gem on the backside of the mom boulder. There are two lines here. This one goes left. Engaging movement on interesting holds. An obvious sit start, and obvious finish.

The landing is good, with some talus factor.

The rock is flaky, and no matter how much you brush it, you will still end up flaking some off, hence 3/4 stars from me.
content.location: Start sitting on the lowest holds you can use, climb up and left to an obvious topout.

content.description: Same start as Mom, but follow the main juggy rail all the way left until it meets the lip.
A good but contrived line staying on the left side of the right arete. Crux at top!
Start laying down using bad crimps on the right.
Start on small crimps and good right foot. Exit right half way up the boulder (just above Party is over arete.
